core_exploration.central_question: How do we structure human resources to optimize both service delivery and operational sustainability?
core_exploration.key_tension: Balancing intensive service delivery with necessary preparation and integration work
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Recognition that facilitators need dedicated time for prep and integration alongside active session delivery
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: The specific cultural and operational advantages of focusing on Latin American resources

conceptual_dna: Sustainable service delivery requires explicit allocation of non-delivery time for preparation and integration
Geographic resource focus can create operational coherence and cultural alignment
Team structure should mirror the rhythm of work rather than just the volume of output

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Combining service delivery optimization with geographic resource specialization
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Sustainable systems require explicit resource allocation for maintenance and preparation, not just production

raw_essence: Effective team structure requires balancing active service delivery with preparation time, while geographic resource focus can create operational coherence. The insight is that facilitators need dedicated non-delivery time built into their workflow for sustainable performance.
